text: I purchased a Braun Series 8 a few years ago.It worked fine for about one year then it stopped working.I reverted to my Braun Series 3 3040 which I got over 7 years ago the Series 3 served me faithfully until the battery failed a few weeks ago.After doing some research I decided to go for the Braun Series 7 this time.I like the following features its equipped with:• AutoSense Technology – This enables the shaver to sense beard density and adjust the motor to the power that is required.• Cutting Actions – The 7 Series offers 24’000 cutting actions per minute.• 360° Flex Head has the ability to adapt and move with the various contours of the face and aims to make shaving tricky areas much easier.• This provides 50 minutes of continuous cordless shaving power. A charge lasts 2 to3 weeks.• It has 3 flexible shaving elements/blades. Two of these are foils, and in the centre, there is a cutter that aims to cut hair that grows in various directions and lift up other hairs to be cut.• Wet & Dry– The Flex Head series is fully waterproof and can be used to shave either wet or dry. You can shave with shaving, cream, soap or foam. (I believe that my series 8 stopped working because I accidentally submerged it in water) this Series 7 claims to be 100% waterproof• Light Indicators – A cleaning light will indicate after using the shaver. A red cord indicator comes on when a user tries to use the shaver when it is plugged in and another red padlock indicator comes on after holding the button (also bleeps) for a few seconds to activate the travel safety switch. There is also battery life and foil cassette indicator (which lets a user know when to replace – every 18 months).• This series 7 has an extra button underneath the power on/off button. When pressed it indicates the battery charge and if the foil cassette needs replacing without switching the shaver on.I am very impressed with this shaver. I shave every day seven (7) days a week and so farit has provided a very clean smooth fast and comfortable shave.However, time will tell about its durability
title: Impressive
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 2, 2022

text: la caja de empaque tiene apariencia de usada, para ser un producto Aleman, les falta calidad en el empaque, la maquina funciona muy bien, rasurado a ras, tal como lo esperaba, en la reseña dice que tiene un sensor en la cuchilla, pero al recibir no se evidencia que lo tenga.

text: I've been using cheap-ish Philips Norelco for 5 years, purchased at Target for like $30, and it was okay-ish. Not perfect, but fast and reliably average.Read a lot of reviews, all praising Braun Series 7 as one of the best electric shavers there is. Bought this one, and frankly, I'm disappointed.Comparing to my old shaver, this one is much slower. The old one didn't care if it's 3-4 days-long brush of new growth, or 1 day - it would shave it off at the same speed, which is essential: my time if valuable in the morning!This one takes significantly longer to get to acceptably clean shave, seems to be cutting hair 0.05mm at a time, thus requiring multiple passes in the same area, which is irritating and takes forever.Tell me, am I using it wrong?Other than that, packaging is good, build quality is good, I like the travel case. It's a shame the trimmer attachment is not built-in and you have to actually switch it. And of course, the cleaning part - I just don't get it. These small particles of shaven hair are everywhere inside. I shake them off, but they cling to the inside surfaces. I hope it's not a big deal, but the cleaning part frustrates me.
title: I was expecting more
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2022

text: Really a difficult review.  The shaver works well.  My beard is tough.  Doesn't get as close as a blade, but close enough for me.  Good for every-other-day approach.  And really nice for touch ups if necessary.  Works well with dry or wet beard.  Doesn't pull hairs or aggravate my skin.  Seems to rinse clean easily.  Comfy to hold.So all that is good...BUT.  As others have mentioned, the documentation for this thing is really beyond terrible.  This is a fairly expensive shaver.  I'd like know that I am using it correctly for best results, and that I'm taking care of it properly to maintain those results and not impact the lifespan of the device.  All you get are goofy little graphics.  Use your words Braun.  It's not that difficult.  Yes, you will need some translations.  Deal with it.A good example of how lacking the documentation is: One picture shows a drop from a small bottle being applied to fingertip then to shaving head.  There is no such small bottle in the box, nor any explanation of what it might be.  So I have to email Braun, find out that this is "light machine oil", then go and buy some of that, as doing this maintenance step weekly is apparently important.  I guess if the bottle of oil was included I could've figured things out, but lacking that and any kind of explanation led me to do way too much work to properly understand what was required for my shaver.So a 4/5 for the shaving experience, but a 0 for the customer experience.
title: Horrible documentation
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 4, 2020

text: This was a surprisingly huge improvement in comfort and errant whisker catching over the series 3, which I returned. Well worth the extra cost. text: My first Braun! I used a panasonic arc 4 before, it was okay. Gives me bumps, not so close shave, and a bit difficult to clean. I went back to manual shaving. This is the best way for me but the process is long and I get pretty lazy sometimes. The series 7 was on sale for prime day so I decided to give it a try. I ran it across my face yesterday and it feels decent. Good close enough shave, and it was easy to clean. My face didn't get bumps or burns! I do wish I spend the extra money for the series 7with the smart care center though. That's my only regret. Yo Braun, you need to sell the smart care center separately in the US so I can get one. Why only UK gets that?

text: I have a Braun Series 3 with cleaning system. It's getting older that's why I wanted to replace it.Since I have a thin face it's sometimes difficult to get every hair straight away. Therefore I thought that Series 7 with flex shaver head would be a good option.When I started the shaver it was really loud, much louder than my old Series 3 shaver. I was really astonished. I was kind of reluctant to use it to shave my face. Then, I used the palm of my hand to explore the flexible the shaver head. It actually has a flexible suspension but comparing it with my Series 3 there hardly was a difference.With that said, I decided to return the shaver. Doesn't make sense to me!
title: Way too loud

text: Feels solid and well made. Shaves very close without irritation. Handles a three day beard without a fuss. I like the shaver a lot.But the manual. Oh dear. It's awful. It really is. Spend some money on a manual with words. Putting it on line would be fine. You put all the legal gibberish in words; put the actual operation manual in words.

text: As this was the first time, at age 78 to purchase and use an electric razor, I am especially pleased on how easy and comfortable it use has become.  I still you a blade for daily usual use, but when in a a hurry or for a quick clean up, I find this of great value.
title: Very easy and effective
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 3, 2021

text: Very nice produce. German made.
title: great product.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 30, 2022

text: I have always held Braun products in high esteem given their German quality. I had an older Series 7, and was in the market for a new one. I saw the positive reviews on this one and decided to give it a try. I am lucky I did as it is fantastic! The new head (they say it has something called 360 Flex technology) makes it feel as if it has a suspension system, allowing the razor to glide over my face. It cuts very well and the battery life is superb. It's also easy to clean making it great for travel. The razor also just looks very cool in the charging stand in my bathroom. Highly recommend it!
title: What a shaver...flex head is a game changer!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 25, 2020

text: I’m happy with how it shaves and has shaved for the last few months except for one thing. My beard typically requires electric razors to be pressed fairly firmly on and doing so with this one the head keeps popping off the razor and then you end up with a mess all over you and the sink.  Disappointed for the cost this happens.
title: One bad flaw for tough beard…
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 17, 2021

text: Doesn't shave as close as I expected wet or dry.
title: Not impressed
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 28, 2022

text: This razer is nice enough.  No thrills... just fine.  The directions are not great on cleaning and use with water
title: Nice enough
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 6, 2021

text: Really works well and is s good value.  Love this brand.
title: It works
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 26, 2021

text: I have been using electric razors since 1976 and the only other one that came close was a Norelco Triple Header I bought in the Navy over 40 years ago and this thing is better than that by 5 miles !!!
title: BEST ELECTRIC RAZOR I HAVE EVER FOUND !!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 14, 2022

text: I had a Series 5 from about 10 years ago, but it was difficult to do my neck (used to have to us a blade razor to finish my neck and some other places, but this does a much nicer job.
title: Does my neck pretty well.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 16, 2020

text: The beard trimmer is great. The body trimmer or whatever you want to call it literally doesn't work. I had to go over a single hair 26 times before it cut.
title: Only half works
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 7, 2023

text: Works well. Takes multiple passes to get a close shave. I can recommend it for those with light beard, its only test.
title: Good buy.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 3, 2021

text: the jury is still up on this one.  I have noticed that when you are outside, and it is hot day, then you come in to clean up and your skin is slightly damp it will cause the head to catch and dislodge and I have even had the three head members dislodge and they can be hell getting them back into the proper location. This was a more expensive shaver and i felt it would be top quality but I am fast losing trust in it. It is a shame as it is a smooth operation and provides a close shave.
title: Braun is a name i have come to trust for quality, but
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 28, 2022

text: I have used Braun shavers for more than 30 years and have always been very satisfied. When came time to update my older series 7 I saw this version on Amazon... Also a series 7 I figured that it would cut just as well... I ordered this one to spice things up as the head pivoted in every direction - I figured it would give a closer shave... WRONG... This is the worst shaver ever... If I shave every day, then maybe it would be OK, but if I skip a few days (say the weekend), shaving on the Monday morning is absolutely BRUTAL!!! It's like if the shaver was pulling every single hair out of my face instead of cutting them!!! I would return it in a nano second but I am out of the US now and can't send it back to Amazon... So, to me, this shaver is garbage... But to those who would say that I am a Braun basher, I have ordered a new shaver to replace this one, also a Braun, but the series 9... I most certainly hope that I will have more luck with that one... Anyway, this model was the BIGGEST letdown ever :(
title: Worst shaver ever!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 13, 2021

text: First time i used it, I was pretty dissapointed but the second time I knew what I was doing and it was a breeze! No annoying cuts or feeling like you've just peeled your face. Highly recommend!
title: Throw that razor away!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 25, 2022

text: Unstable recharging base, no cover to protect shaving screens, and worst of all unusable user instructions. They are black and white illustrations, tightly packed so as to be indecipherable. Should I use a skin prep or shaving creme? Are there particular stokes to use? Helpful hints for a better shave? How to clean after a shave? They provide a brush, but I have no idea where the hair went. The head is clean. Why not provide a link to access a usable owner's manual! Shaves great, but should have sent it back.
title: Sad recharging base
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 17, 2022

text: I've had Braun shavers for 20+ years. When the previous one died (after about 8 years) I decided to "upgrade". This was a great choice as it functions much better than my previous Braun Series 5.
title: Great shaver.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 8, 2022

text: Not what I expected for a regularly priced razor at $150, I got it for $99 on Prime Day. So disappointed that it leaves whiskers behind. Very inconsistent shave, my husband’s face doesn’t look as if he shaved at all. Not a close shave at all, visible stubble left behind.
title: Not worth the money
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 8, 2021

text: La calidad del producto fue malo la navaja había que usarla demasiado fuerte, lo termine devolviendo
title: No me gusto
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 23, 2023

text: Disappointing, I knew this would not replace a razor, but it is not close.The precision is blade is weak.Overall very disappointing, not worth it.
title: Disappointing, I knew this would not replace a razor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 3, 2022

text: I haven't had an electric shaver since I was a young man. I am now 83. Niice clean shave, no burn, no iritation.I love everything about my new Braun.
title: Great close shave!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 15, 2022

text: My husband didn't really care for this razor because the hair falls out of it and onto his clothes.  He was using it this week and it just broke.  The head broke and will no longer shave him.  We just bought it for almost $130 on 12/28/2022.
title: Broke within 3 months.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 6, 2023

text: Gives a much better shave than my Phillip’s rotary. The instructions that come with the shaver are useless so you are on your own to figure it out  I have used it for three weeks and the battery is still full charge
title: Gives a good shave
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 25, 2021
